bwwExcerpt: This notion is reinforced again and again over the course of nearly three hours of cat-and-mouse play. Portraying the lesser mortals who end up as collateral damage in the Marquise and Vicomte's tedious warfare, Raffi Barsoumian, ELena Kampouris and especially Birgitte Hjort Sorensen (as the unfortunate Madame de Tourvel) have little to do other than look bewildered or cry out in psychic pain.
